affinity_system.description: RAID Shadow Legends uses a 4-affinity system with strength/weakness relationships similar to elemental systems in other games.

relationships.notes: Void affinity is always neutral (no strengths or weaknesses)

strong_affinity.description: +15% damage dealt, -15% damage taken, 0% glancing hit chance

weak_affinity.description: -15% damage dealt, +15% damage taken, 30% glancing hit chance (glancing hits deal 70% damage and cannot crit)
weak_affinity.combined_damage_loss: ~35-40% total damage loss (base -15% + 30% chance of -30% damage + no crits on glancing hits = ~40% DPS loss for crit-dependent champions)

glancing_hit_mechanics.description: When attacking with weak affinity, 30% of hits become glancing hits. Glancing hits deal 70% of normal damage and CANNOT crit. This eliminates Warmaster/Giant Slayer procs on glancing hits.
glancing_hit_mechanics.impact_on_dps: For crit-dependent champions (Warmaster/Giant Slayer), glancing hits effectively remove 30% of attacks from damage calculation. Combined with base -15% damage, total DPS loss is ~35-40%.
glancing_hit_mechanics.notes: Glancing hits are marked with a distinct visual indicator in combat (smaller damage numbers, different color)

clan_boss_affinity_rotation.void_day: BEST for testing and baseline damage (no affinity variance)
clan_boss_affinity_rotation.favorable_affinity_day: Expected +10-15% team damage vs baseline (if champions have favorable affinity)
clan_boss_affinity_rotation.unfavorable_affinity_day: Expected -10-15% team damage vs baseline (if champions have weak affinity)
clan_boss_affinity_rotation.example: Geomancer (Magic affinity) vs Spirit Boss = weak affinity = -10 to -15M damage loss (from 44M baseline to ~34-39M)

team_building.affinity_safe_core: Build core team with neutral affinities to boss rotation (e.g., all Spirit/Void/Magic for Force boss days)
team_building.flex_swaps: Keep affinity-weak champions as alternates (swap out on unfavorable days)
team_building.void_champions_value: Void champions are always safe (no weak affinity), premium for consistent performance

metadata.validation: Cross-referenced with in-game testing, community wikis (Ayumilove, HellHades)
metadata.notes: Comprehensive affinity system mechanics for team building and damage variance analysis
